author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tension prevailed at Government Hospital in Tiruchengode when a 25-year-old woman died at the hospital, two hours after delivering the baby. Alleging that the death was due to the negligence of the doctors, relatives staged protest on the hospital premises.

Kumar (30), a labourer of Kumaramangalam Pudur, was married to Sathya and has two children.

On Friday, she was admitted to Primary Health Centre in Manickampalayam with labour pain and was later shifted to GH in Tiruchengode at 2 p.m.

But relatives said that due to the absence of doctors, treatment was not provided to her till 6 p.m. At 6.30 p.m. she delivered a male baby, but died later.

Stating that medical negligence led to her death, relatives refused to sign the documents for post-mortem and staged protest in the hospital.

On Saturday, Kumar lodged a complaint with Tiruchengode Town police. A team led by Tiruchengode Revenue Divisional Officer G. Mahatma, DSP Muralidharan and doctors held talks with the protesters.

They wanted the sections to be altered and post-mortem be done by team of doctors.

They also demanded action against the doctors for their negligence in duty. The police which initially registered a case under Section 174 of CrPC altered the Section as 304A (causing death by negligence).

Later, doctors, Sangeetha and Karthick, from Salem Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital conducted the post-mortem and the body handed over to the relatives.
title: Woman’s death sparks tension
